bug.author: erotavlas
bug.summary: TypeError: '>' not supported between instances of 'dict' and 'dict'
bug.description: spacy version: 2.2.4 command: python -m spacy train Error: TypeError: '>' not supported between instances of 'dict' and 'dict' When saving best model <denchmark-code> 98 157.185 93.324 94.212 93.766 100.000 26623 31692 99 133.271 93.464 94.286 93.873 100.000 26254 32800 100 148.529 93.455 94.139 93.796 100.000 25557 32948 ✔ Saved model to output directory G:\train3\models\model-final ⠼ Creating best model... Traceback (most recent call last): File "D:\Anaconda\envs\spacy\lib\runpy.py", line 193, in _run_module_as_main "__main__", mod_spec) File "D:\Anaconda\envs\spacy\lib\runpy.py", line 85, in _run_code exec(code, run_globals) File "D:\Anaconda\envs\spacy\lib\site-packages\spacy\__main__.py", line 33, in <module> plac.call(commands[command], sys.argv[1:]) File "D:\Anaconda\envs\spacy\lib\site-packages\plac_core.py", line 367, in call cmd, result = parser.consume(arglist) File "D:\Anaconda\envs\spacy\lib\site-packages\plac_core.py", line 232, in consume return cmd, self.func(*(args + varargs + extraopts), **kwargs) File "D:\Anaconda\envs\spacy\lib\site-packages\spacy\cli\train.py", line 583, in train best_model_path = _collate_best_model(final_meta, output_path, best_pipes) File "D:\Anaconda\envs\spacy\lib\site-packages\spacy\cli\train.py", line 643, in _collate_best_model bests[component] = _find_best(output_path, component) File "D:\Anaconda\envs\spacy\lib\site-packages\spacy\cli\train.py", line 666, in _find_best return max(accuracies)[1] TypeError: '>' not supported between instances of 'dict' and 'dict' </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/adrianeboyd>@adrianeboyd</denchmark-link> How can I overcome this? Do you have a nightly release I can install with the mentioned fix? I tried but it says version 2.1.

We don't have a current spacy-nightly available right now, I'm afraid. But you have two other options:
Build the current master branch from source (I don't think this is necessary - it may be a bit of overhead if you haven't done this before) Apply the changes linked by Adriane to your local spacy/cli/train.py file. This should hopefully be quite straightforward: just make sure to add these 5 lines to the correct places.
